title: Rustc version says "nightly" after updating to 1.17.0 stable
body:
Hi everyone,

After updating to rust 1.17, rustc says that it is a nightly version and the commit hash is not the same reported by rustup.
```
ufo@ufo-laptop:~/workspaces/rust
$ rustup update stable
info: syncing channel updates for 'stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu'
info: downloading component 'rustc'
 37.2 MiB /  37.2 MiB (100 %)   2.2 MiB/s ETA:   0 s                
info: downloading component 'rust-std'
 61.6 MiB /  61.6 MiB (100 %)   2.2 MiB/s ETA:   0 s                
info: downloading component 'cargo'
  4.8 MiB /   4.8 MiB (100 %)   2.2 MiB/s ETA:   0 s                
info: downloading component 'rust-docs'
 10.1 MiB /  10.1 MiB (100 %)   2.1 MiB/s ETA:   0 s                
info: downloading component 'rust-src'
 30.4 MiB /  30.4 MiB (100 %)   2.3 MiB/s ETA:   0 s                
info: downloading component 'rust-std' for 'x86_64-unknown-linux-musl'
 13.4 MiB /  13.4 MiB (100 %)   2.2 MiB/s ETA:   0 s                
info: installing component 'rustc'
info: installing component 'rust-std'
info: installing component 'cargo'
info: installing component 'rust-docs'
info: installing component 'rust-src'
info: installing component 'rust-std' for 'x86_64-unknown-linux-musl'

  stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu updated - rustc 1.17.0 (56124baa9 2017-04-24)

ufo@ufo-laptop:~/workspaces/rust
$ rustc --version
rustc 1.17.0-nightly (ea7a6486a 2017-02-04)

ufo@ufo-laptop:~/workspaces/rust
$ rustup --version
rustup 1.0.0 (17b6d21 2016-12-15)
```
I have never installed a nightly build and the rustc version was correct before the update .

System info:
Ubuntu 16.04 64bit
